title: Fragmentary monumental Latin inscription from the amphitheatre
support: four separate blocks each bearing one or more letters, which appear to join up to form part of a monumental text

provenanceFound._: First reported by Paolo Orsi in 1889, as lying in the garden of the custodian's hut near the amphitheatre, and as coming originally from the amphitheatre

provenanceObserved._: No autopsy, but last reported as in the chiesetta di S. Nicolò, just north of the amphitheatre at the entrance to the archaeological park.

repository._: Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco

museum.name: Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco
museum.description: Archaeological park, containing the Greek theatre, altar of Hieron, Roman amphitheatre, and ancient stone quarries.
